title: how do i boot eset sysrescue and bitdefender rescue disk from USB?

forumNotes.author: Neel
online
forumNotes.content:
I love ESET Smart Security, although practically I *never* keep installed my copy on my current/alwaysunderconstruction system for more than few hours/days at time...  
I like ESET SysRescue too.  

This should 100% work  

```
title ESET SysRescue (4.0.437)

map (hd0,0)/boot/eset.iso (hd32)

map --hook

chainloader (hd32)/BOOTMGR

rootnoverify (hd32)
```

Note that the ISO file must be defragmented; otherwise use **--mem** parameter, but the iso is 230MB.

forumNotes.author: tsetya
forumNotes.content:
for bitdefender, try to extract following file from iso image to usb fd /KNOPPIX/\*.\* /Docs/\*.\* /boot/isolinux/linux /boot/isolinux/minirt.gz and add following command to menu.lst ``` title BitDefender Live USB kernel /boot/isolinux/linux ramdisk_size=131072 init=/etc/init lang=us apm=power-off vga=791 nomce loglevel=0 BOOT_IMAGE=knoppix initrd /boot/isolinux/minirt.gz ```
you can add "find --set-root " command if necessary for updating virus database, download cumulative from [http://download.bitd...bitdefender_v9/](http://download.bitdefender.com/updates/bitdefender_v9/ "External link")

forumNotes.author: tsetya
forumNotes.content:
renaming file/folder will not work. just keep the same folder/file name with iso image.  
so far i did test 7 different AV live cd, dr.web, kaspersky, GData, Bitdefender, FSecure, Avira, Trinity Rescue Kit (clamav), only FSecure and Bitdefender have the same file/folder name (knoppix base).

forumNotes.author: online
forumNotes.content:
> online i used the the same procedure on "active boot disk" but it keeps asking me the username and license key which i have already embedded with the iso, is there a solution for this?  
>
> Entry in menu.lst  
> title 5. Active Boot Disk  
> find --set-root /tools/abotdsk.iso  
> map (hd0,0)/tools/abotdsk.iso (hd32)  
> map --hook  
> chainloader (hd32)/BOOTMGR  
> rootnoverify (hd32)
For ABD it is enough as follows  

```
title Active@ Boot Disk Suite

map (hd0,0)/tools/abotdsk.iso (hd32)

map --hook

chainloader (hd32)
```

The trick in order to avoid the key request at program startup consists to copy your "bootdisk.key" file in the **root** of your UFD.  
Enjoy!
